set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=libarchive PACKAGE_VERSION=3.1.2
oegimport libiconv oegimport gettext oegimport bzip2 oegimport expat oegimport libxml2 oegimport xz oegimport zlib #oegimport pcre # fails to link against, looks in wrong place for it
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.gz
mkdir -p "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}" cp COPYING README "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/packages/${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}/"
#configure looks for: lzo, nettle, openssl, pcre #configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-libiconv-prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-expat=${OEG_BASE_DIR} #export PATH=$PATH:/open-egovernment/bin # some tool during configure needs expat-1.dll
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-sysroot=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} --without-lzo2 --without-nettle --without-openssl
make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv bin/*.dll bin64/ rm -rf bin # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
